info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 6 at 8:44AM EDT until April 9 at 3:00PM EDT by NWS Charleston WV
info.description:
...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in West Virginia...Ohio...
Ohio River At Belleville Lock affecting Jackson, Meigs and Wood Counties.
For the Ohio River...Moderate flooding is forecast.
* WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Ohio River at Belleville Lock.
* WHEN...From this afternoon to Wednesday afternoon.
* IMPACTS...At 34.0 feet, Water begins to cover Route 124 at the mouth of Laucks Run, north of Portland. At 35.0 feet, Ohio State Route 124 is flooded north of Stiversville Road, at Rock Run, at Wells Run to Smith Ridge to Dewitts Run, at Forked Run, at Curtis Hollow Road and between Long Bottom and Shade River. Ohio State Route 124 near the Washington and Meigs County line is flooded. At 38.0 feet, Route 124 towards Racine is flooded. Sections of Ohio State Route 248 at Sand Hill are flooded.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 AM EDT Sunday the stage was 32.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this afternoon to a crest of 38.0 feet tomorrow evening. It will then fall below flood stage late Wednesday morning. - Flood stage is 35.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 38.3 feet on 04/06/2018. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Report flooding to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 800 401 9535, when you can do so safely.
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/rlx.
The next statement will be issued this evening at 845 PM EDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON

area.areaDesc: Meigs, OH; Jackson, WV; Wood, WV
